intro: Trachymene gigantea, commonly known as giant trachymene, is a striking perennial herb native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its fern-like foliage and showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows up to 2 meters tall, featuring a hollow, cylindrical stem and palmate leaves. Its flowers are clustered in umbels, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. Trachymene gigantea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
